FC Saarbrucken", "TSV 1860 Munchen"… #> $ visitor       <chr> "Borussia Dortmund", "1. FC Koln", "Eintracht Braunschwe… #> $ goals_home    <int> 3, 0, 1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 3, 4, 3, 4, 2, 2, 3, 1, 1, 0, 2,… #> $ goals_visitor <int> 2, 2, 1, 1, 0, 1, 4, 1, 3, 2, 0, 0, 3, 0, 1, 0, 3, 4, 3,…

title: Get available countries — uss_countries
text: countries league-play data available engsoccerdata.

title: Get available countries — uss_countries
text: character vector containing names available countries.

title: Get a league-play tibble — uss_get_matches
text: Gets league-play data game, engsoccerdata, returning tibble standardised format.

title: Get a league-play tibble — uss_get_matches
text: country one spain, italy, germany, holland, england

title: Get a league-play tibble — uss_get_matches
text: dataframe, tibble columns country, tier, season, date, home, visitor, goals_home, goals_visitor.

title: Get a league-play tibble — uss_get_matches
text: uss_countries() returns available choices; "england" default. function relies internal function, uss_make_matches(), parse source data.

what: Makes a standard dataframe for league data — uss_make_matches
title: Makes a standard dataframe for league data — uss_make_matches
text: Makes standard dataframe league data

title: Makes a standard dataframe for league data — uss_make_matches
Makes a standard dataframe for league data — uss_make_matches
text: data_engsoc dataframe engsoccerdata package country one spain, italy, germany, holland, england

title: Makes a standard dataframe for league data — uss_make_matches
text: dataframe, tibble columns country, tier, season, date, home, visitor, goals_home, goals_visitor.

title: Makes a standard dataframe for league data — uss_make_matches
code: uss_make_matches(engsoccerdata::spain, "Spain") #> # A tibble: 23,915 × 8 #>    country tier  season date       home               visitor    goals…¹ goals…² #>    <chr>   <fct>  <int> <date>     <chr>              <chr>        <int>   <int> #>  1 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-10 Arenas de Getxo    Atletico …       2       3 #>  2 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-10 Espanyol Barcelona Real Union       3       2 #>  3 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-10 Real Madrid        CE Europa        5       0 #>  4 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-10 Real Sociedad      Athletic …       1       1 #>  5 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-12 Racing Santander   FC Barcel…       0       2 #>  6 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-17 FC Barcelona       Real Madr…       1       2 #>  7 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-17 Athletic Bilbao    Espanyol …       9       0 #>  8 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-17 Atletico Madrid    Real Soci…       0       3 #>  9 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-17 Real Union         Racing Sa…       3       1 #> 10 Spain   1       1928 1929-02-17 CE Europa          Arenas de…       5       2 #> # … with 23,905 more rows, and abbreviated variable names ¹​goals_home, #> #   ²​goals_visitor #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

title: Make season-based calculations — uss_make_seasons_cumulative
text: Given teams-matches data frame (returned uss_make_teams_matches()), return return data frame wins, losses, points, etc.: cumulative, course season: uss_make_seasons_cumulative()

title: Make season-based calculations — uss_make_seasons_cumulative
code: uss_make_seasons_cumulative(   data_teams_matches,   fn_points_per_win = uss_points_per_win )  uss_make_seasons_final(   data_teams_matches,   fn_points_per_win = uss_points_per_win )

title: Make season-based calculations — uss_make_seasons_cumulative
text: data_teams_matches data frame created using uss_make_teams_matches() fn_points_per_win function vectorized arguments country, season, returns integer indicating points-per-win. default function provided, uss_points_per_win(), includes countries uss_countries().

title: Make season-based calculations — uss_make_seasons_cumulative
text: tibble columns country, tier, season, team, date, matches, wins, draws, losses, points, goals_for, goals_against.

title: Make season-based calculations — uss_make_seasons_cumulative
code: italy <- uss_get_matches("italy") |> uss_make_teams_matches() uss_make_seasons_cumulative(italy) #> # A tibble: 50,808 × 12 #> # Groups:   country, tier, season, team [1,516] #>    country tier  season team     date       matches  wins draws losses points #>    <chr>   <fct>  <int> <chr>    <date>       <int> <int> <int>  <int>  <int> #>  1 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-10-06       1     1     0      0      2 #>  2 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-10-13       2     2     0      0      4 #>  3 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-10-20       3     2     0      1      4 #>  4 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-10-27       4     3     0      1      6 #>  5 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-11-03       5     3     1      1      7 #>  6 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-11-10       6     3     1      2      7 #>  7 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-11-17       7     3     1      3      7 #>  8 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-11-24       8     4     1      3      9 #>  9 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-12-08       9     4     1      4      9 #> 10 Italy   1       1929 AC Milan 1929-12-15      10     5     1      4     11 #> # … with 50,798 more rows, and 2 more variables: goals_for <int>, #> #   goals_against <int> #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows, and `colnames()` to see all variable names uss_make_seasons_final(italy) #> # A tibble: 1,516 × 12 #> # Groups:   country, season, tier [85] #>    country tier  season team        date       matches  wins draws losses points #>    <chr>   <fct>  <int> <chr>       <date>       <int> <int> <int>  <int>  <int> #>  1 Italy   1       1929 Inter       1930-07-06      34    22     6      6     50 #>  2 Italy   1       1929 Genova 189… 1930-07-06      34    20     8      6     48 #>  3 Italy   1       1929 Juventus    1930-07-06      34    19     7      8     45 #>  4 Italy   1       1929 Torino FC   1930-07-06      34    16     7     11     39 #>  5 Italy   1       1929 SSC Napoli  1930-07-06      34    14     9     11     37 #>  6 Italy   1       1929 AS Roma     1930-07-06      34    15     6     13     36 #>  7 Italy   1       1929 Bologna FC  1930-07-06      34    14     8     12     36 #>  8 Italy   1       1929 US Alessan… 1930-07-06      34    14     8     12     36 #>  9 Italy   1       1929 Pro Vercel… 1930-07-06      34    12     9     13     33 #> 10 Italy   1       1929 Brescia Ca… 1930-07-06      34    13     7     14     33 #> # … with 1,506 more rows, and 2 more variables: goals_for <int>, #> #   goals_against <int> #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows, and `colnames()` to see all variable names

title: Make a teams-matches tibble — uss_make_teams_matches
text: essentially matches data; , row returned every combination team match. Thus two rows returned row data_matches tibble: one team.

title: Make a teams-matches tibble — uss_make_teams_matches
text: data_matches data.frame created using uss_get_matches() uss_make_matches()

title: Make a teams-matches tibble — uss_make_teams_matches
text: tibble columns country, tier, season, team, date, opponent, at_home, goals_for, goals_against; ordered country, tier, season, team, date.

title: Make a teams-matches tibble — uss_make_teams_matches
code: uss_get_matches("england") |>   uss_make_teams_matches() |>   dplyr::filter(team == "Leeds United") |>   tail() #> # A tibble: 6 × 9 #>   country tier  season team         date       at_home opponent  goals…¹ goals…² #>   <chr>   <fct>  <int> <chr>        <date>     <lgl>   <chr>       <int>   <int> #> 1 England 3       2009 Leeds United 2010-04-10 TRUE    Southend…       2       0 #> 2 England 3       2009 Leeds United 2010-04-13 FALSE   Carlisle…       3       1 #> 3 England 3       2009 Leeds United 2010-04-17 FALSE   Gillingh…       2       3 #> 4 England 3       2009 Leeds United 2010-04-24 TRUE    Milton K…       4       1 #> 5 England 3       2009 Leeds United 2010-05-01 FALSE   Charlton…       0       1 #> 6 England 3       2009 Leeds United 2010-05-08 TRUE    Bristol …       2       1 #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​goals_for, ²​goals_against

title: Plot over season-final results — uss_plot_seasons_tiers
text: Returns ggplot: season x-axis faceted team two layers: rectangles shaded tier points showing wins y-axis countries included uss_countries(), "england" data one tier.

title: Plot over season-final results — uss_plot_seasons_tiers
text: data_seasons, data frame created using uss_make_seasons_final(). aes_y, expression use y-axis ncol, integer-ish number columns facet.

title: Plot over season-final results — uss_plot_seasons_tiers
text: Object S3 classes "gg", "ggplot", .e. ggplot2 object.

title: Plot over season-final results — uss_plot_seasons_tiers
code: leeds_norwich <-   uss_get_matches("england") |>   uss_make_teams_matches() |>   dplyr::filter(team %in% c("Leeds United", "Norwich City")) |>   uss_make_seasons_final() |>   dplyr::arrange(team, season)  # use default (wins) uss_plot_seasons_tiers(leeds_norwich)

title: Calculate points — uss_points_per_win
text: Given country season, return number points win.

title: Calculate points — uss_points_per_win
text: country one spain, italy, germany, holland, england season integer-ish year football season. default integer-ish default value points-per-win, used value country uss_countries().

title: Calculate points — uss_points_per_win
text: integer number points per win

title: Calculate points — uss_points_per_win
text: function vectorized country season; length. country uss_countries, warning issued, default value used.
